revised_title: Improving Electro-Magnetic Measurements and Lifting Power
tldr: The author, Dr. Ritchie, critiques the common deflecting galvanometer and proposes a torsion galvanometer for more accurate measurements in electro-magnetism. He also investigates the relationship between the lifting power of electro-magnets and their length, finding that their lifting powers are nearly inversely proportional to the square root of their lengths. Dr. Ritchie concludes that electro-magnetic power is unlikely to replace voltaic batteries for chemical decomposition.
